headline: T-Mobile US boss set to leave post early, Handelsblatt newspaper reports
summary: FRANKFURT (Reuters) -The head of T-Mobile U.S., the fast-growing and profitable subsidiary of Germany's Deutsche Telekom, is due to step aside before the end of his current contract, German newspaper Handelsblatt reported on Monday.  Handelsblatt reported Mike Sievert, who has headed the mobile operator since 2020, wanted to take a break and that Chief Operating Officer Srini Gopalan, until recently head of Deutsche Telekom's Germany business, was a leading candidate to succeed him.

headline: Should You Hold Onto American Tower Stock in Your Portfolio for Now?
summary: AMT gains from 5G and data center demand, but Sprint churn and high debt weigh on near-term growth.
